name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Senior Java Backend Engineer
professional_summary: Utilized Java 8+ for building scalable backend systems, focusing on object-oriented design and functional programming to optimize performance in insurance claim processing systems.
Engineered microservices using Spring Boot and Spring Cloud, ensuring seamless integration with AWS services for healthcare data management, adhering to HIPAA compliance.
Designed and deployed RESTful APIs with OpenAPI/Swagger documentation, facilitating secure data exchange between banking systems and third-party services.
Managed dependencies and build processes using Maven, streamlining CI/CD pipelines for consulting projects to ensure efficient deployment.
Implemented schema design and query optimization in relational databases like MySQL and PostgreSQL, enhancing data retrieval speeds for insurance analytics platforms.
Integrated NoSQL databases such as MongoDB for handling unstructured data in healthcare applications, ensuring scalability and performance.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve production issues in microservices, minimizing downtime for banking transaction systems.
Applied microservice patterns to design distributed systems, improving modularity and maintainability in consulting client projects.
Configured and managed Azure services for cloud-native applications, ensuring high availability and disaster recovery for banking solutions.
Developed and maintained unit tests using JUnit and Mockito, ensuring code reliability in insurance policy management systems.
Participated in code reviews and pair programming sessions to uphold code quality and share knowledge within the team.
Migrated monolithic applications to microservices architecture, reducing latency and improving scalability for healthcare patient portals.
Implemented transaction management and concurrency control in Java applications, ensuring data integrity in banking transaction systems.
Utilized Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration, deploying microservices in production environments for consulting clients.
Monitored application performance using tools like Prometheus and Grafana, identifying and resolving bottlenecks in insurance claim processing systems.
Documented technical designs and architecture decisions, ensuring knowledge transfer and maintainability of healthcare data platforms.
Mentored junior developers in Java best practices and Spring Framework, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
Adapted to evolving project requirements, learning new technologies and methodologies to deliver robust solutions in dynamic consulting environments.
